intro: Bikkia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered bikkia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes willows and other flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. It produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators. The leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
